alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Randolph County through 345 PM EDT... At 319 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Fountain City, or 13 miles north of Centerville, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Randolph County, including the following locations... Union City, Lynn and Modoc. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Indiana.
